messages.message:
Is there a way to run Instabase on an older version of the DB? I checked out the `release-22.01.0` locally to fix a bug and test, but I’m getting DB errors which I presume is because I’m running old code against the dogfood DB that has the new migrations.
```2022/05/09 18:43:42 ERROR utils/acl/base_resource.go:303 -- Failed to get repo. Err: sql: expected 10 destination arguments in Scan, not 7
2022/05/09 18:43:42 ERROR utils/acl/base_resource.go:303 -- Failed to get repo. Err: QueryRow failed. Err: 0: connection is nil
2022/05/09 18:43:42 ERROR reposervice/handler/repo.go:254 -- Fail: sql: expected 10 destination arguments in Scan, not 7```
I’m hoping we can restore a backup in a new tiny DB instance and I (and others) can point my local env to that.

i think you can setup a local mysql database for testing? You would have to run the dbinit script from the 22.01 branch against it. And you would point the DB connection string at `"--username=root --host=localhost --database=<yourdb> --port=3306"`
Ooh good idea. I’ll try that
You can follow the “how to run locally” section in this doc for instructions on dbinit https://docs.google.com/document/d/1op1n3ESOPa1vu0o-UaCQwVHO1f2Eah_2zax5aYnVIlA/edit#heading=h.ojkyaeuqh416
